snippet: Montana campaign-finance laws are being threatened by the Supreme Court, so I signed a petition for a constitutional amendment to ban corporate money from all elections.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Montana Gov Brian Schweitzer warns that Montana's strict campaign-finance laws, which have made the state's political system one of the most transparent in the nation, are being threatened by the Supreme Court's decision in Citizens United; explains why he is supporting a federal constitutional amendment that would enshrine the right of a state to ban corporate money in political campaigns.
lead_paragraph: Montana campaign-finance laws are being threatened by the Supreme Court, so I signed a petition for a constitutional amendment to ban corporate money from all elections.

headline.seo: An Invitation to Keep Money Out of Politics
